channel.title: Enums :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: enum provides a way to create integer constants. For instance, in Java we might declare: public static final int GOLD = 1; public static final int SILVER = 2; public static final int BRONZE = 3; ..but really what we want is to create a “medal” type that can take on the values GOLD, SILVER, and BRONZE. Moreover, we want GOLD to mean “1”, SILVER to mean “2”, and BRONZE to mean “3”. (Note: Java does have enums available in its latest version, which are handled very similarly to how they are in C.)
